intro: Nunnezharia costaricana, commonly known as the Costa Rican nunnezharia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
